Subscribe to ETPrime Today Search + Home ETPrime Markets Market Data News Industry SME Politics Wealth MF Tech AI Careers Opinion NRI Panache Videos More Menu Business News › ev SEARCHED FOR: EV Diesel demand growth falls to lowest since pandemic India's diesel demand growth hit a pandemic-era low in fiscal year 2024-25, rising just 2% due to a slowing economy and the increasing adoption of electric vehicles. While diesel still dominates the transport sector, the shift to EVs in public transport and logistics is moderating its growth. 14 Apr, 2025, 04:11 PM IST This Rs 1.3 crore BMW is the only car Gippy Grewal’s son will drive: Check Punjabi singer's luxury car collection, net worth Punjabi actor-singer Gippy Grewal recently shared details about his luxury car collection, revealing that his 17-year-old son Ekom exclusively drives a Rs 1.3 crore BMW M3, gifted to him on his 16th birthday. Gippy owns five high-end vehicles, including a Hummer EV, Tesla Cybertruck, Tesla X, and two BMWs. Reflecting on his humble beginnings, he spoke about starting with a second-hand Maruti and gradually working his way up to owning dream cars like the Range Rover Sport. 13 Apr, 2025, 03:18 PM IST How to calculate the EV to MCAP Ratio and why it matters for investors 13 Apr, 2025, 01:10 PM IST Swedish hedge fund billionaire Christer Gardell issues stark Tesla warning, predicts massive valuation crash could hit sooner than investors expect Tesla stock crash warning is making headlines after Swedish billionaire Christer Gardell predicted a shocking 95% drop could hit the company. In a bold interview with EFN, Gardell called Tesla’s valuation “incomprehensible” and pointed to slowing sales, Elon Musk’s political drama, and Cybertruck struggles as red flags. While Tesla leads in EV innovation, Gardell warns the bubble could soon burst. 12 Apr, 2025, 10:06 PM IST Tesla debuts in Saudi Arabia with first showroom and service center in Riyadh Tesla has officially launched operations in Saudi Arabia, showcasing its Cybertruck and Model Y. This move signals improved relations between Elon Musk and the kingdom, despite a past feud. Saudi Arabia aims for 30% EV adoption by 2030, but faces infrastructure challenges with limited charging stations. 12 Apr, 2025, 07:41 PM IST Delhi's EV policy may create 20,000 jobs; focus on battery swapping and charging network Delhi is gearing up for a major electric vehicle push. The new EV policy 2.0 aims to create jobs and boost EV adoption. Battery collection centers and charging stations are planned across the city. The government targets a high percentage of new EV registrations by 2027. Phasing out of CNG autos and fossil fuel vehicles is also on the cards. 12 Apr, 2025, 03:06 PM IST All News Videos Go To Page 1 JSW MG Motor India expects EVs to account for up to 65 pc of total sales by2025-end JSW MG Motor India anticipates that electric vehicles will constitute up to 65% of its total sales by the end of this year, building on the momentum of EVs already representing 50% of their 2024 sales. The company's Windsor model has achieved a milestone of 20,000 units sold in just six months. 11 Apr, 2025, 03:45 PM IST Delhi govt likely to offer up to Rs 36,000 subsidy to women under EV Policy 2.0 Delhi government's proposed EV Policy 2.0 offers subsidies, potentially up to Rs 36,000, for women purchasing electric two-wheelers. The policy aims to boost EV adoption by providing incentives for two and three-wheelers, commercial vehicles, and scrapping old ICE vehicles. It also recommends phasing out CNG autorickshaws and fossil fuel vehicles to combat air pollution. 11 Apr, 2025, 03:01 PM IST India offers UK an EV trade-off: Luxury imports for budget exports India has proposed unlimited electric vehicle imports priced above GBP 80,000 from the UK to facilitate a free trade agreement. This is in exchange for a larger export quota of smaller EVs priced below GBP 40,000 from India to the UK. The proposal aims to benefit automakers in both countries and potentially influence trade discussions with the US. 11 Apr, 2025, 12:04 AM IST GreenLine invests $275m in Green Logistics; Nikhil Kamath invests $20m Essar venture GreenLine Mobility aims to transform Indian trucking. The company secures $275 million for green logistics. Nikhil Kamath invests $20 million. GreenLine plans to deploy 10,000 LNG and EV trucks. A network of 100 refuelling and charging stations is planned. The company targets a reduction of 1 million tonnes of carbon emissions annually. 10 Apr, 2025, 05:27 PM IST Enjoy zero cost mobility with EVs and rooftop solar charging Increasing emphasis on rooftop solar energy generation makes EVs fully green from well to wheel as they can be conveniently charged from the energy produced without any use of fossil fuel while delivering the added benefit of near zero running costs. This further lowers the total cost of ownership of EVs. 10 Apr, 2025, 12:15 PM IST Audi India expands electric vehicle charging initiative to over 6.5k points Audi India has significantly expanded its electric vehicle charging infrastructure across the country, installing over 6,500 charging points as part of its 'Charge My Audi' initiative. This Phase II expansion includes a focus on DC fast-charging technology and partnerships with 16 new EV infrastructure providers. 10 Apr, 2025, 12:14 PM IST Kolkata set to get India's largest EV charging hub, second only to China India's largest single-site EV charging hub is being built in south Kolkata's Thakurpukur area by EzUrja, with 300 chargers. It will be the second-largest in the world, after China’s facility with 650 chargers. The hub, costing Rs 7.5 crore, will serve Snap-E’s electric cabs and feature fast and slow chargers. It aims for eco-friendly operations with solar panels and a microgrid. 09 Apr, 2025, 08:13 PM IST Foxconn eyes Japan for electric vehicle growth, seeks partnerships The contract manufacturer is set to introduce an electric bus and a battery-powered microbus in Japan in 2027, it said. It focuses on providing business-to-business services with its EV operations instead of targeting consumers directly. Foxconn wants to cooperate with Nissan but is currently not engaging with the struggling Japanese automaker, Seki told the Nikkei newspaper in an interview published earlier on Wednesday. 09 Apr, 2025, 04:01 PM IST Tesla’s $584 billion wipeout: 4 forces behind the EV giant’s accelerating 45% stock car Tesla’s lead in EV infrastructure is at risk. In March, Chinese competitor BYD launched a next-gen fast-charging station that provides 400 kilometers (around 250 miles) of range in just five minutes, surpassing Tesla's top Supercharger performance. 09 Apr, 2025, 03:12 PM IST Draft EV Policy 2.0: In green push, Delhi plans to phase out non-electric 3-wheelers, 2-wheelers Delhi's upcoming EV Policy 2.0 proposes phasing out CNG autorickshaws, with no new registrations after August 15th. Existing CNG permits won't be renewed, replaced by e-auto permits. The policy targets fossil fuel vehicles used for waste management and city buses, mandating a complete electric transition by 2027. 09 Apr, 2025, 12:20 AM IST Elon Musk once mocked China’s BYD. Now the EV giant is outselling Tesla Elon Musk's Tesla is facing hard times. The stocks have tanked, sales have declined and its showrooms and dealerships have been facing massive violence in US and other parts of the world. An old video of Elon Musk mocking Chinese electric vehicle (EV) giant BYD has surfaced. But now, things have changed and BYD has surged ahead of Tesla. 08 Apr, 2025, 06:07 PM IST Revolt Motors aims to double sales outlets by end of current fiscal Revolt Motors, RattanIndia Enterprises' EV arm, plans to double its sales network to 400 dealerships by the end of FY26, expanding from the current 200 locations. The company is focusing on reaching Tier 2 and 3 cities across 23 states and Union Territories in India. 08 Apr, 2025, 12:42 PM IST Video of BYD EV doing parallel parking, avoiding obstacles by raising itself goes viral Chinese EV giant BYD has unveiled its luxury EV, the Yangwang U7, featuring impressive capabilities like automatic suspension adjustments and autonomous parallel parking. Launched in March 2025, it offers both plug-in hybrid and fully electric options, boasting 1,287 hp with an innovative energy recovery suspension system. 07 Apr, 2025, 05:51 PM IST After Trump, EU seeks zero tariff from India on car imports, sources say The European Union wants India to scrap high car import tariffs under a pending trade deal. Sources say India may cut duties in phases to 10% from over 100%, despite industry calls to keep a 30% tariff and protect EV makers by maintaining current rates for another four years. 07 Apr, 2025, 03:05 PM IST CATL in talks to buy controlling stake in Nio's power unit, sources say CATL is in discussions to acquire a controlling stake in Nio's power unit, which operates over 3,000 battery swapping stations in China. This follows CATL's earlier investment of 2.5 billion yuan in March. Nio Power's strategic importance is underscored by its collaborations with major EV brands and the potential expansion of its swapping network. 07 Apr, 2025, 02:31 PM IST Toyota to boost EV models to 15, targets producing 1 million by 2027, Nikkei says Toyota plans to develop around 15 electric vehicle models by 2027 and aims to produce about 1 million cars annually by then. With existing models only manufactured in Japan and China, Toyota's expansion to the US, Thailand, and Argentina aims to mitigate risks and reduce delivery times. The 15 models will include some from its Lexus brand. 07 Apr, 2025, 07:28 AM IST How to calculate EV/EBIT ratio 06 Apr, 2025, 02:41 PM IST EV sales set for rapid growth; penetration likely to touch 12-13 pc over 5 yrs: Hyundai COO Hyundai Motor India anticipates rapid growth in electric vehicle penetration, projecting an increase to 12-13% over the next 4-5 years, driven by favourable policies and OEMs like Tata Motors, Mahindra, and Maruti Suzuki entering the market. The company plans to boost EV infrastructure with 600 public fast-charging stations. 06 Apr, 2025, 12:39 PM IST Tesla's entry will help grow EV market in India, not worried about competition: BMW BMW Group India remains optimistic about the EV market, viewing Tesla’s entry as a growth catalyst. CEO Vikram Pawah says competition boosts demand. BMW sold 646 EVs in Q1 2025 and aims for 15% of total sales from EVs this year, a target it expects to exceed. Globally, BMW saw 13.5% BEV sales growth in 2024. 06 Apr, 2025, 10:13 AM IST Recyclers collected over 2,500 metric tonnes of lithium-ion EV waste batteries since 2022: Government Recyclers in India have collected over 2,570 metric tonnes of lithium-ion waste batteries from EVs in the past three years, according to Union Minister Kirti Vardhan Singh. The country generated nearly 5 million metric tonnes of electronic waste between 2021-2023. New Battery Waste Management Rules mandate proper recycling to prevent environmental contamination. 03 Apr, 2025, 07:25 PM IST BMW expects 30 pc of its India sales to come from electric vehicles by 2030 BMW expects 30% of its sales in India to come from electric vehicles by 2030. The company reported a tripling of electric car sales in the first quarter of 2025. Despite challenges faced by mainstream automakers like Tata Motors and Maruti Suzuki, BMW's customer adoption of EVs is growing, supported by a range of price options. 03 Apr, 2025, 06:53 PM IST Accelerating EV adoption key to improving air quality Rapid electrification of our vehicle fleet presents a viable solution. Electric vehicles, powered by batteries rather than fossil fuels, promise a dramatic reduction in air pollution. Transitioning to EVs not only conserves precious foreign exchange by minimising crude oil imports but also removes tailpipe emissions, leading to cleaner air. 03 Apr, 2025, 05:54 PM IST India backs EV tariff cuts for Trump trade deal, defying autos lobby, sources say India plans to reduce import tariffs on electric cars, prioritizing a trade deal with the United States. This move, set to be part of the first tranche of tariff reductions, aims to address the concerns of U.S. stakeholders like Tesla, despite opposition from local automakers invested in the domestic EV market. 02 Apr, 2025, 05:29 PM IST Load More Top Trending Terms Sensex Today Gold Rate Today Crypto Crash Ethereum, Solana Price Waqf Amendment Bill News Live Updates Best April Fools Pranks Over Text DOE Result 2025 Thailand Earthquake Updates Live Earthquake Video Today DC vs LSG Live Score DC vs LSG Key Players Prasanna Sankar IPL 2025 Opening Ceremony Live Updates KKR vs RCB Playing 11 Eli Lilly Weight Loss Drug Karnataka Bandh Reason Nowruz Wishes 2025 Warriors vs Kings Madhuri Dixit UPPRPB Result NEET Correction Window 2025 New Income Tax Regime Investment Frauds Is there a bank holiday today? For reprint rights: Times Syndication Service Cookies Settings BACK TO TOP Privacy Preference Center When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. Allow All Manage Consent Preferences Targeting Cookies Targeting Cookies These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising. Functional Cookies Functional Cookies These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly. Performance Cookies Performance Cookies These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance. Strictly Necessary Cookies Always Active These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.
